question_sentence: Which SNP politician this week argued that “the incompetent handling” of the Covid-19 crisis by Westminster “builds the case” for Scottish independence?
Newly published data from the Office of National Statistics (ONS) shows that Britain’s GDP fell by how much in March?
Boris Johnson has been photographed holding a memo that urged him not to meet alone with which senior Tory MP?
The head of which country’s industry federation this week warned that a no-deal Brexit would be ‘catastrophe’ for the UK?
Which airline is reportedly seeking both private investors and a £500m bailout from the government in a bid to stave off collapse?
Australian scientists have proposed what new solution to help protect coral reefs from climate change?
choices: Moving icebergs to warm water to decrease the temperature
Genetically engineering coral algae to tolerate heat
Creating rain clouds to decrease evaporation

question_sentence: People convicted of deliberately coughing on or spitting at front-line workers during the coronavirus outbreak can be sentenced to a maximum of how long in prison?
The US embassy in which African nation has warned that there is a risk of “exponential growth” of Covid-19 cases in the country?
A healthcare firm advised by which Conservative MP has been handed a £133m coronavirus testing contract ‘unopposed’?
By how much did the number of TV licences bought in the UK fall in the five months to March?

A collective $72.9 billion was spent on nuclear weapons by the world’s nuclear-armed nations in 2019, according to a report released this week. Which country accounted for about half of that, with about $35.4 billion spent?
evidence: The US spent $35.4 billion on nuclear weapons in 2019, about half of the collective total.

question_sentence: Which two major media companies made major job cuts this week, in an effort to stave off economic fallout from the coronavirus?
evidence: Despite earlier cuts made by both companies, Condé Nast is laying off about 100 staffers in the US and furloughing about another 100, while BuzzFeed has made cuts to both its UK and Australia offices.

question_sentence: The family of Breonna Taylor has filed a wrongful death lawsuit after Taylor, an EMT, was shot and killed in March while local police were executing a search warrant in a narcotics investigation.  Where did the shooting occur?
evidence: The incident occurred at Taylor’s Louisville home, where a man involved in a drug ring was allegedly sending shipments in order to avoid detection. At the time of her death, a suspect had already been apprehended at another location.

question_sentence: Star MLB pitcher Blake Snell said this week he wouldn’t take a pay cut to return to playing baseball this year, because the risk is higher. What team does he play for?
evidence: “You all are going to be like, ‘Blake, play for the love of the game – what’s wrong with you? The money should not be a thing,’” the Rays player said. “Bro. I am risking my life.” His sentiments echo other opinions around the baseball community.

question_sentence: Which athlete celebrated their birthday this week by announcing the return of two iconic video games?
evidence: “Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater” 1 and 2 are being remastered for Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC, the skater announced this week, to be released on September 4.

question_sentence: The governor of which state walked back a previous executive order this week, which issued thousands of licenses to teen drivers without a driver’s test due to the pandemic?
evidence: Gov. Brian Kemp of Georgia signed a new executive order this week, saying that those teens given licenses will have to take a driver’s test after all.

question_sentence: The coronavirus-induced economic downturn is especially affecting low-income households. What percentage of low-income households reported a job loss in March, according to a new report?
evidence: Nearly 40% of those with a household income below $40,000 reported a job loss in March, according to the Economic Well-Being of US Households report.

question_sentence: Hundreds of factory workers at a fish processing plant have tested positive for coronavirus, all from contact with a single worker. Where is the factory located?
evidence: More than 500 employees were infected at the factory, located in the port city of Tema.

question_sentence: Which senator stepped down as Intelligence Committee chairman this week, after the FBI seized his phone as part of a probe into stock transactions he made ahead of the market downturn?
evidence: Senator Burr, A Republican from North Carolina, has been scrutinized for selling up to $1.7 million in stocks in February after he received closed-door briefings about the virus before the market began trending downward.

question_sentence: Which state’s Capitol was closed Thursday, due to demonstrators gathering to protest extended stay-at-home orders?
evidence: The latest protest in Michigan came two weeks after protesters, some armed, entered the Capitol building and demanded to be allowed into the legislative chambers.
